source.title: Bootstrap your own latent: A new approach to self-supervised learning

confidence_rationale: Direct evidence that predictor/target asymmetry and slow target updates stabilize representation learning.

mapping.source_claim_statement: BYOL uses an online predictor and a slowly updated target network to avoid collapse and improve representation quality.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports MECH-058 core claim that anchor timescale separation can stabilize substrate learning under nonstationarity.
mapping.mapping_caveat: ML setting lacks explicit biological pathway constraints and may not transfer one-to-one to REE control loops.
mapping.source_context: Self-supervised visual representation learning benchmark results.

confidence_components.notes: Strong engineering evidence for timescale-separated anchor mechanism.
